title: Will filing for bankruptcy remove a civil judgement from a car accident (no alcohol involved)?
question: My boyfriend has a 1.2 million dollar judgement against him from a car accident he was in back in 1994. He was sued because his license expired 2 days prior to the accident. There is no way he can pay it back and now with interest and fees, he owes over 5.5 million dollars.
answers:
Short answer is yes- money judgment can be discharged under Chapter 7.

My colleague is very correct is asking you whether or not the judgment is still valid and the first step is in fact figuring out whether the judgment that is being enforced is valid.

I hope this helps-

Nima Taradji

The first question is if the judgment has been renewed? Judgments are valid for only 10 years. They can be renewed. If no renewal, they cannot enforce the judgment. He can find out by reviewing the court file online and seeing if a renewal filed in 2003 or 2004.

If it was renewed he should be able to get it discharged in a Chapter 7 bankruptcy.

I agree with my California colleague. The first step is to check if the judgment was renewed 10 years from the date the judgment was entered. Most California Courts have websites you can check to see if the judgment was renewed. If it is still valid, assuming your boyfried qualifies, Chapter 7 bankruptcy should discharge the money judgment.

You should call a bankruptcy attorney in the bay area to discuss your options.
